title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7200.5 - Requests for public access to records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7200.5 - Requests for public access to records

State Regulations
(a) Except as otherwise provided in this
section, all requests for access to records of the commission shall be in
writing and shall reasonably describe the record or records sought. Such
description may include dates, file designations or any other available
identifying information. (b) The
records access officer may, in his discretion, accept oral requests for
records. (c) Within five business
days of receipt of a request for a record, the records access officer shall: (1)
make such record available to the person
requesting it; (2)
deny such
request in accordance with the provisions of section
7200.6
of this Part; or
(3)
furnish a written acknowledgment of the
receipt of such request and a statement of the approximate date when the
request will be granted or denied. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7200.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
